entries: Der Golem ist bei Rettungswürfen gegen Zauber und andere magische Effekte im Vorteil.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: Die Waffenangriffe des Golems sind magisch.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Der Golem führt zwei Hiebangriffe aus.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} Treffer, Reichweite 5 ft., ein Ziel. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) Schaden durch Wucht.
{@link Flesh Golem|https://angrygolem-games.com/monster-manual/letter-f/flesh-golem-5e-stats/}
{@link FLESH GOLEM's TACTICS (read the article)|https://angrygolem-games.com/monster-manual/letter-f/flesh-golem-5e-stats/}
BESCHREIBUNG

Die Teile des Golems müssen aus den toten Körpern normaler Menschen, die noch nicht stark verwest sind, zusammengenäht werden. Es müssen mindestens 6 verschiedene Körper verwendet werden, einer für jede Gliedmaße, einer für den Torso (mit Kopf) und ein anderer für das Gehirn. In manchen Fällen können mehr Körper notwendig sein, um einen vollständigen Golem zu bilden. Die benötigten Zaubersprüche sind {@spell wish}, {@spell polymorph} beliebiger Gegenstand, {@spell geas}, {@spell Protection from Energy|PHB|protection from normal missiles} und Stärke.

trait.name: Advanced Telepathy
entries: Der Flumph kann den Inhalt jeder telepathischen Kommunikation wahrnehmen, die im Umkreis von 60 Fuß um ihn herum verwendet wird, und er kann nicht von Kreaturen mit irgendeiner Form von Telepathie überrascht werden.

trait.name: Prone Deficiency
entries: Wenn der Flumph {@condition prone} umgeworfen wird, würfelst du. Bei einem ungeraden Ergebnis landet der Flumph auf dem Kopf und ist {@condition incapacitated}. Am Ende jeder ihrer Runden kann die Flumph einen {@dc 10} Rettungswurf in Geschicklichkeit machen, um sich aufzurichten und den {@condition incapacitated} Zustand zu beenden, wenn sie erfolgreich ist.

trait.name: Telepathic Shroud
entries: Der Flumph ist immun gegen alle Effekte, die seine Emotionen spüren oder seine Gedanken lesen, sowie gegen alle Wahrsagezauber.

action.name: Tendrils
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} Treffer, Reichweite 5 ft., eine Kreatur. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) Stich-Schaden, plus 2 ({@damage 1d4}) Säure-Schaden. Am Ende jeder seiner Runden muss das Ziel einen {@dc 10} Rettungswurf auf die Konstitution machen. Bei einem Fehlschlag erleidet es 2 ({@damage 1d4}) Säureschaden, bei einem Erfolg wird der wiederkehrende Säureschaden beendet. Ein {@spell Lesser Restoration} Zauber, der auf das Ziel gewirkt wird, beendet ebenfalls den wiederkehrenden Säureschaden.

action.name: Stench Spray (1/Day)
entries: Jede Kreatur in einem 15-Fuß-Kegel, der von der Flamme ausgeht, muss einen {@dc 10} Rettungswurf in Geschicklichkeit bestehen oder wird mit einer übel riechenden Flüssigkeit überzogen. Eine umhüllte Kreatur verströmt für {@dice 1d4} Stunden einen furchtbaren Gestank. Die umhüllte Kreatur ist {@condition poisoned}, solange der Gestank anhält, und andere Kreaturen sind {@condition poisoned}, solange sie sich im Umkreis von 5 Fuß um die umhüllte Kreatur befinden. Eine Kreatur kann den Gestank an sich selbst entfernen, indem sie eine kurze Pause nutzt, um in Wasser, Alkohol oder Essig zu baden.
{@link Flumph|https://angrygolem-games.com/monster-manual/letter-f/flumph-5e-stats/}
BESCHREIBUNG

Flumph ähneln Luftquallen. Diese seltsamen Kreaturen sind rund und fast flach, vielleicht ein oder zwei Zentimeter dick in der Mitte und verjüngen sich auf ein oder zwei Zentimeter in der Nähe des Randes. Der Körper ist meist hohl, ähnlich wie ein großes Kissen. In der Mitte der Oberseite befindet sich eine runde Öffnung, die von zwei Augenstielen flankiert wird, die jeweils etwa sechs Zoll lang sind. Von der Unterseite des Wesens hängen mehrere kurze Tentakel herab, hinter denen sich eine Vielzahl kleiner Stacheln verbirgt. Die Tentakel, die dem Rand der Flumph am nächsten sind, können für feine Manipulationen an kleinen Objekten verwendet werden. Eine gewöhnliche Flumph ist reinweiß; eine Klosterflumph ist im Allgemeinen blassgelb oder grün und hat dunklere Tentakel.

Ein Flumph fliegt, indem er Luft durch das Loch auf seiner Oberseite einsaugt und sie durch mehrere kleine Löcher auf seiner Unterseite ausstößt. Die Kreatur hat auch mehrere kleine Öffnungen entlang ihres Äquators, die ihr beim Manövrieren helfen. Normalerweise schwebt sie etwa vier bis sechs Zentimeter über dem Boden. Um ihren Körper in der Luft zu halten, benötigt sie keine großen Mengen an Luft. Sie erzeugt eine leichte Brise, und in einer ruhigen Umgebung ist ein leichtes Pfeifen zu hören.

Gewöhnliche Flumphs können sich nicht stimmlich verständigen, haben aber eine einzigartige Zeichensprache, bei der sie ihre Tentakel und Augenstiele einsetzen. Einige Mönchsflumphs, vielleicht 10 %, können eine andere Sprache sprechen und verstehen.
COMBAT

Der Flumph überlebt, indem er kleine Lebewesen wie Ratten, Eidechsen, Frösche und dergleichen jagt. Der Flumph schwebt knapp über dem Boden oder hängt regungslos im Schilf oder einer ähnlichen Versteckmöglichkeit. Wenn er eine kleine Kreatur findet, erhebt er sich ein oder zwei Meter und stürzt sich dann auf seine Beute, wobei seine Stacheln bei einem erfolgreichen Angriff 1d4 +2 Punkte Stichschaden verursachen.

Außerdem scheiden die Tentakel der Flumphs Verdauungssäuren in die Wunden aus; die Säure verursacht jede Runde zusätzlich 1d4 Punkte Säureschaden. Sobald die Beute tot ist, lässt sich der Flumph auf ihr nieder und nimmt über seine Tentakel Nährstoffe auf. Flumphs müssen ihre gesündere Beute oft über eine kurze Distanz verfolgen, bevor das Opfer stirbt. Die Säure kann durch vollständiges Eintauchen in einen schnell fließenden Strom, durch aktives Abwaschen der Säure (volle Rundenaktion) mit einem {@spell Create Food and Water|PHB|Create Water}-Zauber (einfaches Eintauchen oder Abspülen funktioniert nicht) oder durch einen {@spell Lesser Restoration}-Zauber auf das Ziel weggespült werden.

Wenn er von einer größeren Kreatur bedroht wird, versucht der Flumph normalerweise, sie zu vertreiben, indem er eine übel riechende Flüssigkeit aus einer Öffnung an seinem Äquator spritzt, die sich vorne befindet. Wenn diese Methode der Vertreibung fehlschlägt, kann sich der Flumph bis zu 10 Fuß hoch erheben und sich auf einen Gegner stürzen, als würde er jagen.
LEBENSRAUM / GESELLSCHAFT

Der gemeine Flumph ist ein nomadischer Jäger, intelligent, gut verbündet und friedlich. Ein Flumph pflanzt sich etwa alle zwei Jahre durch Knospung fort, wobei er 1d8 winzige Flumphs auf seiner Unterseite produziert. Diese werden nach etwa drei Monaten unabhängig, wenn sie einen Durchmesser von zwei Zoll erreichen. Sie wachsen innerhalb eines Monats zur Erwachsenengröße heran und leben 20 Jahre lang.
ECOLOGIE

Flumphs sind Raubtiere am unteren Ende der Nahrungskette, die sich von kleineren Kreaturen ernähren und ihr Gebiet von Ungeziefer säubern. Das Fleisch der Flumphs hat einen üblen Geschmack und gilt im Allgemeinen als ungenießbar, obwohl Oger und einige Goblinoiden sie gerne essen.
Klösterliche Flumphs

Die selten zu sehenden Klosterflumphs sind fortgeschrittenere Kreaturen, die Zaubersprüche wirken können, als wären sie Kleriker mit einer Stufe, die ihren Trefferwürfeln entspricht. Sie versammeln sich in Klöstern, um Wissen zu teilen und Gottheiten zu verehren, die den Humanoiden unbekannt sind. Ein Kreuzgang befindet sich normalerweise in einer großen Höhle oder (in Sümpfen und Graslandschaften) in einer großen, nestartigen Laube aus Gras und Schlamm. Das Innere eines Klosters ist mit feinen, farbenfrohen Malereien verziert, die von Flumphs mit ihren Tentakeln aus natürlichen Pigmenten hergestellt werden. Die Malereien sind in der Regel abstrakt und zeigen Spiralen und andere geschwungene Linien, obwohl einige vage Darstellungen von Flumphs bei der Jagd zu sehen sind.
Jedes Kloster wird von einem {@creature abbot flumph|AGGMM} geleitet.
Der Abt wird von einem {@creature prior flumph} pro sechs Flumphs im Kreuzgang unterstützt.
Der Rest der Flumphs sind {@creature monk flumph|AGGMM}.
Gelegentlich trifft man in der Nähe eines Klosters auf eine kleine Gruppe gewöhnlicher Flumphs, die Essen als Gegenleistung für Heilung oder Führung anbieten.

trait.name: Flyby
entries: Die Schlange provoziert keine Gelegenheitsangriffe, wenn sie aus der Reichweite des Gegners fliegt.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} Treffer, Reichweite 5 ft., ein Ziel. {@h}1 ({@damage 1}) Stichschaden, plus 7 ({@damage 3d4}) Giftschaden.
{@link Flying Snake|https://angrygolem-games.com/monster-manual/letter-f/flying-snake-5e-stats/}
BESCHREIBUNG

Fliegende Schlangen, auch bekannt als "fliegende Reißzähne", waren einst in den wärmeren Gebieten der Reiche zahlreich, aber sie sind so gefährlich, dass alle intelligenten Völker sie gnadenlos jagen. In den heißen Ländern gibt es viele Geschichten über Echsenmenschen und Yuan-ti, die fliegende Schlangen abrichten, um für sie zu jagen, oder die lernen, mit den Schlangen als Partner zusammenzuarbeiten.

Diese Reptilien haben hinter ihrem Kopf ein Paar aufflackernde, fledermausartige, ledrige Flügel. Sie können mit akrobatischer Gewandtheit fliegen, schweben, kopfüber fliegen und ihre Schwänze und Körperwindungen einsetzen, um Opfer in der Luft zu behindern.
Fliegende Schlangen können von beliebiger Farbe und Aussehen sein. Die meisten haben flache, spitze, viperähnliche Köpfe, rote oder gelbe Augen und smaragdgrüne oder bronzefarbene Schuppen.
COMBAT

Fliegende Schlangen beißen und schneiden mit ihren nadelscharfen Reißzähnen oder spucken Säure auf Gegner in bis zu 10 Fuß Entfernung. Ein Säurespieß verursacht 1d4 Säureschaden an Gewebe, Haut oder Stoff, kann aber weder Metall noch Stein angreifen.

Die fliegenden Reißzähne schlagen immer in die Gesichter ihrer Feinde und versuchen, die Wesen zu blenden, damit sie von den Reißzähnen nach Belieben erschlagen und verschlungen werden können. Die Schlangen greifen jedes Lebewesen an, von dem sie glauben, dass sie es töten und fressen können.

Gegen kleine oder kleinere Kreaturen kann eine fliegende Schlange ihr Opfer packen und einwickeln. Dies verursacht keinen Schaden, verringert aber die Geschwindigkeit des Opfers auf 5 Fuß und entfernt den Geschicklichkeitsbonus auf die Rüstungsklasse. Um sich um einen Gegner zu wickeln, muss eine fliegende Schlange einen erfolgreichen Angriffswurf machen. Erlaubt ist ein Versuch in jeder zweiten Kampfrunde als zusätzlicher Angriffswurf.
ECOLOGIE

Eine einzige fliegende Schlange frisst an einem Tag das Fünffache ihres Gewichts, wenn sie es schafft, so viel zu bekommen. Jagdflüge töten oft ein Dutzend mannshohe Opfer oder mehr, wenn sie davon ausgehen, dass andere Raubtiere die Leichen für spätere Mahlzeiten ungestört lassen.

trait.name: Antimagic Susceptibility
entries: Das Schwert wird außer Gefecht gesetzt, solange es sich im Bereich eines {@spell antimagic field} befindet. Wenn es von {@spell dispel magic} getroffen wird, muss das Schwert einen Rettungswurf in Konstitution gegen den Zauberschutz-DC des Zaubernden bestehen oder 1 Minute lang bewusstlos werden.

trait.name: False Appearance
entries: Das Schwert bleibt zwar unbeweglich und fliegt nicht, aber es ist nicht von einem normalen Schwert zu unterscheiden.

action.name: Longsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} bis zum Treffer, Reichweite 5 ft., ein Ziel. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d8 + 1}) Hiebschaden.
{@link Flying Sword|https://angrygolem-games.com/monster-manual/letter-f/flying-sword-5e-stats/}
BESCHREIBUNG
Ein magisch animiertes, fliegendes Schwert tanzt durch die Luft und kämpft wie ein Krieger, der nicht verletzt werden kann.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Der Fomorianer greift zweimal mit seiner Großkeule an oder macht einen Angriff mit der Großkeule und setzt einmal das Böse Auge ein.

action.name: Greatclub
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} bis zum Treffer, Reichweite 15 Fuß, ein Ziel. {@h}19 ({@damage 3d8 + 6}) Schaden durch Wucht.

action.name: Evil Eye
entries: Der Fomorianer zwingt eine Kreatur, die er im Umkreis von 60 Fuß sehen kann, auf magische Weise dazu, einen {@dc 14} Charisma-Rettungswurf zu machen. Bei einem misslungenen Schutzwurf erleidet die Kreatur 27 ({@damage 6d8}) psychischen Schaden, bei einem erfolgreichen Schutzwurf halb so viel Schaden.

action.name: Curse of the Evil Eye (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: Mit einem Blick setzt der Fomorianer Böses Auge ein, aber bei einem misslungenen Schutzwurf wird die Kreatur zusätzlich mit magischen Deformationen verflucht. Solange die Kreatur deformiert ist, ist ihre Geschwindigkeit halbiert und sie hat einen Nachteil bei Fähigkeitsprüfungen, Rettungswürfen und Angriffen, die auf Stärke oder Geschicklichkeit basieren. Die verwandelte Kreatur kann den Rettungswurf jedes Mal wiederholen, wenn sie eine lange Ruhepause beendet, wobei der Effekt bei einem Erfolg beendet wird.
{@link Fomorian|https://angrygolem-games.com/monster-manual/letter-f/fomorian-5e-stats/}
BESCHREIBUNG
Fomorianer sind die abscheulichsten, deformiertesten und bösartigsten aller Riesenvölker. Die fomorianischen Riesen sind allesamt ekelhaft deformierte Ungetüme.

Eine unvollständige Liste von Deformationen umfasst verstellte Gliedmaßen, verformte Gliedmaßen, verstellte Gesichtszüge, bucklige, wulstige Körperteile, hängendes Fleisch, zu große oder zu kleine Körperteile, Klappohren, riesige Schnauze, große Füße auf kurzen Beinen.

Ihre dicken, haarigen Häute, kombiniert mit den Fellen und seltsamen Metallteilen, die sie zum Schutz tragen. Auf ihrer blassen, weißen Haut haben sie vereinzelte Flecken mit Haaren, die hart wie Draht sind. Große Warzen und andere Wucherungen sind über ihren Körper verstreut.

Es gibt keinen einheitlichen Geruch, der mit Fomorianern in Verbindung gebracht wird; einige riechen aufgrund überaktiver Schweißdrüsen stark, andere haben keinen Geruch. Auch ihre Stimmen sind aufgrund ihrer einzigartigen Deformierungen unterschiedlich.
LEBENSRAUM / GESELLSCHAFT
Fomorianer leben in Berghöhlen, verlassenen Minen oder anderen unterirdischen Gefilden. Sie verändern ihre Behausungen nur selten, sondern passen sich an das an, was schon da ist.
Diese deformierten Riesen wandern durch den unterirdischen Komplex, über fast jede Entfernung, nur gestoppt von Gefahren, die sie nicht herausfordern wollen.
Ein Fomorianerclan sucht sich eine kleine, (für sie) verteidigungsfähige Nische als Versteck aus. Ihr Territorium wird manchmal durch die Leichen ihrer Feinde markiert.
Ihr Schatz besteht nur aus gestohlenen Gegenständen von Feinden. Rüstungsteile werden zu ihrem eigenen Patchwork-Schutz hinzugefügt.
Da sie sich nicht um sie kümmern, verschlechtert sich diese Rüstung schnell und wird wertlos.
Ihre Gesellschaft wird von Verderbtheit und Bosheit beherrscht. Der stärkste und grausamste Riese herrscht über alle anderen, die in Reichweite sind, und das sind meist nur wenige.
Die Frauen und Kinder werden wie Sklaven behandelt. Gewalttaten sind unter Fomorianern weit verbreitet und führen manchmal zu dauerhaften Verletzungen oder zum Tod.

Fomorianische Riesen sind dafür bekannt, dass sie mit anderen Kreaturen für böse Zwecke zusammenarbeiten. Normalerweise müssen die anderen Kreaturen die Fomorianer vollständig beherrschen oder dazu in der Lage sein, um eine Allianz zu bilden.

Eine solche Vereinbarung hält nur so lange, wie die Fomorianer ihre Mitstreiter fürchten. Sobald ihre Interessen nicht mehr übereinstimmen oder die Fomorianer sich nicht mehr bedroht fühlen, betrügen sie ihre Partner so schnell wie möglich.
ECOLOGIE
Diese verdrehten Riesen können wochenlang mit wenig oder gar keiner Nahrung auskommen. Das ist auch gut so, denn in ihren unterirdischen Behausungen gibt es keine Nahrung im Überfluss.

Sie können fast jedes organische Material fressen, darunter Pilze, Flechten, Pflanzen aller Art, Fledermäuse, Mäuse und Fische. Besonders gut schmecken ihnen große Säugetiere, vor allem solche, die darum betteln, nicht gefressen zu werden.
Die Zubereitung einer Mahlzeit ist in der Regel eher eine Tortur als eine geschmackliche Verbesserung.

trait.name: He who knows the Truth
entries: Jeder, der von Forsetis Avatar befragt wird, erhält eine ehrliche Antwort.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Er kann für seine Zauber auf die Sphären Charme, Kampf, Weissagung und Schutz zurückgreifen.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Forsetis Avatar führt zwei Angriffe mit seinem Schwert der Schärfe +5 aus.

action.name: Sword of Sharpness +5
entries: {@atk ms} {@hit 20} bis zum Treffer, Reichweite 5 ft., ein Ziel. {@h}15 ({@damage 1d8 + 11}) Hiebschaden. Wenn der Avatar sein Schwert gegen ein Wesen schwingt, das innerhalb der letzten sieben Tage eine Lüge gesprochen hat, verfehlt er es nie.
{@link Forseti, Norse Avatar|https://angrygolem-games.com/monster-manual/letter-f/forseti-norse-avatar/}
BESCHREIBUNG
Forsetis Avatar nimmt die Form eines normal aussehenden Mannes an, nur dass er ungewöhnlich ruhig und selbstsicher wirkt.
{@link God & Clergy (go to page)|https://angrygolem-games.com/monster-manual/letter-f/forseti-god-and-clerics-for-dd-5e/}

trait.name: Lord of the Horses
entries: Kein Pferd wird jemals gegen Freys Avatar in die Schlacht reiten.

trait.name: Control Weather
entries: Er kann alle Regenwolken in seiner Sichtweite innerhalb von 1 Runde beschwören oder vertreiben.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Er kann die Sphären der Tiere, des Zaubers, der Schöpfung, der Weissagung, der Pflanzen, der Sonne und des Wetters für seine Zaubersprüche anrufen.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Freys Avatar führt zwei Angriffe mit seinem Zweihandschwert +3 aus.

action.name: Two-handed Sword +3
entries: {@atk ms} {@hit 19} bis zum Treffer, Reichweite 5 ft., ein Ziel. {@h}15 ({@damage 1d10 + 10}) Hiebschaden. Jeder, der vom Schwert des Avatars getroffen wird, muss einen {@dc 20} Rettungswurf machen, sonst verliert er jeden Kampfeswillen und verlässt den Weg des Kämpfers.
{@link Frey, Norse Avatar|https://angrygolem-games.com/monster-manual/letter-f/frey-norse-avatar/}
BESCHREIBUNG
Freys Avatar ist ein gut aussehender junger Mann.
{@link God & Clergy (go to page)|https://angrygolem-games.com/frey-god-and-clerics-for-dd-5e/}

action.name: Amazing Beauty
entries: Jedes männliche Wesen, das den Avatar ansieht, muss einen {@dc 18} Weisheits-Rettungswurf machen oder wird {@condition charmed} von ihrer Schönheit getroffen.

action.name: Fiery Dagger +5
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 13} bis zum Treffer, Reichweite 5 ft., ein Ziel. {@h}15 ({@damage 4d4 + 5}) Hiebschaden. Wer von dem feurigen Dolch des Avatars getroffen wird, muss einen {@dc 17} Rettungswurf machen oder in Flammen aufgehen (und {@dice 2d10} Schadenspunkte erleiden). Diese magischen Flammen brennen so lange, bis ein erfolgreicher Bannzauber auf sie angewandt wird.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Sie kann sich auf die Magieschulen Abjuration und Verzauberung/Zauberspruch berufen.

entries: {@link Freya, Norse Avatar|https://angrygolem-games.com/monster-manual/letter-f/freya-norse-avatar/}
BESCHREIBUNG
Freyas Avatar nimmt die Form einer unglaublich üppigen, schönen Frau an.
{@link God & Clergy (go to page)|https://angrygolem-games.com/freya-god-and-clerics-for-dd-5e/}

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Sie kann für seine Zaubersprüche auf jede Schule der Magie zurückgreifen.

trait.name: Necklace of black opals
entries: Friggas Avatar trägt eine Halskette aus schwarzen Opalen, die ihn in seiner Nähe verzaubert ({@dc 21} Rettungswurf der Weisheit, um dies zu negieren).

action.name: Dagger of Wind
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 13} bis zum Treffer, Reichweite 5 ft., ein Ziel. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d4 + 4}) Stich-Schaden. Jeder, der von ihrem Dolch getroffen wird, muss einen {@dc 21} Stärke-Rettungswurf machen, um von einem starken Wind zwei Meilen weit weggetragen zu werden.
{@link Frigga, Norse Avatar|https://angrygolem-games.com/monster-manual/letter-f/frigga-norse-avatar/}
BESCHREIBUNG

Friggas Avatar ist eine schöne, etwas matronenhafte Frau. Friggas Avatar trägt eine Halskette aus schwarzen Opalen, die ihn in seiner Nähe verzaubert (DC 21 Rettungswurf der Weisheit, um dies zu negieren).
{@link God & Clergy (go to page)|https://angrygolem-games.com/frigga-god-and-clerics-for-dd-5e/}

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: Der Frosch kann Luft und Wasser atmen

trait.name: Standing Leap
entries: Der Weitsprung des Frosches beträgt bis zu 10 Fuß und der Hochsprung bis zu 5 Fuß, mit oder ohne Anlauf.

action.name: No Action
entries: Ein Frosch hat keine wirksamen Angriffe. Er ernährt sich von kleinen Insekten und hält sich normalerweise in der Nähe von Wasser, in Bäumen oder unter der Erde auf. Die Statistiken des Frosches können auch für eine Kröte verwendet werden.
{@link Frog|https://angrygolem-games.com/monster-manual/letter-f/frog-5e-stats/}

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: Der Froschhemoth kann Luft und Wasser atmen.

trait.name: Shock Susceptibility
entries: Wenn der Froschhemoth Blitzschaden erleidet, erleidet er bis zum Ende seines nächsten Zuges mehrere Auswirkungen: seine Geschwindigkeit wird halbiert, er erleidet einen Malus von -2 auf AC und Rettungswürfe in Geschicklichkeit, er kann keine Reaktionen oder Mehrfachangriffe einsetzen und in seinem Zug kann er entweder eine Aktion oder eine Bonusaktion einsetzen, nicht beides.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Der Froschhemoth führt zwei Angriffe mit seinen Tentakeln aus. Er kann auch seine Zunge benutzen oder beißen.

action.name: Tentacle
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} auf Treffer, Reichweite 10 Fuß, ein Ziel. {@h}19 ({@damage 3d8 + 6}) Wuchtschaden, und das Ziel ist {@condition grappled} (Flucht {@dc 16}), wenn es eine riesige oder kleinere Kreatur ist. Bis zum Ende des Haltegriffs kann der Froschhemoth diesen Tentakel nicht auf ein anderes Ziel anwenden. Der Froschfresser hat vier Tentakel.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} Treffer, Reichweite 5 ft., ein Ziel. {@h}22 ({@damage 3d10 + 6}) Stich-Schaden und das Ziel wird verschluckt, wenn es sich um eine mittlere oder kleinere Kreatur handelt. Eine verschluckte Kreatur ist {@condition blinded} und {@condition restrained}, hat totale Deckung vor Angriffen und anderen Effekten außerhalb des Froschhemoths und erleidet zu Beginn jeder Runde des Froschhemoths 10 ({@damage 3d6}) Säureschaden. Der Schlund des Froschhemoths kann bis zu zwei Kreaturen auf einmal aufnehmen. Wenn der Froschfresser in einem einzigen Zug 20 Schadenspunkte oder mehr durch eine Kreatur in seinem Inneren erleidet, muss der Froschfresser am Ende dieses Zuges einen {@dc 20} Rettungswurf auf Konstitution bestehen oder alle verschluckten Kreaturen wieder auswürgen, von denen jede {@condition prone} in einen Raum innerhalb von 10 Fuß um den Froschfresser fällt. Wenn der Froschhemoth stirbt, wird eine verschluckte Kreatur nicht länger {@condition restrained} von ihm gehalten und kann mit einer Bewegungszeit von 10 Fuß aus dem Leichnam entkommen, indem sie {@condition prone} verlässt.

action.name: Tongue
entries: Der Froschhemoth zielt auf eine mittlere oder kleinere Kreatur, die er im Umkreis von 20 Fuß sehen kann. Das Ziel muss einen {@dc 18} Stärke-Rettungswurf machen. Bei einem misslungenen Schutzwurf wird das Ziel in einen unbesetzten Raum im Umkreis von 5 Fuß um den Froschfresser gezogen, und der Froschfresser kann als Bonusaktion einen Bissangriff gegen das Ziel durchführen.
{@link Froghemoth|https://angrygolem-games.com/monster-manual/letter-f/froghemoth-5e-stats/}
BESCHREIBUNG

Dieser riesige amphibische Schrecken lauert in den dunkelsten Sümpfen und feuchtesten unterirdischen Tümpeln. Der 18 Fuß lange und 10 Fuß breite Körper des Froschhemoths ist am Bauch gelb, an den Seiten hellgrün und auf dem Rücken und den dicken, gebogenen Hinterbeinen grün gesprenkelt. Aus jeder Schulter entspringen zwei Tentakel. Die Tentakel sind 15 Fuß oder mehr lang, oben grün und unten gelblich. Die Nasenlöcher der Kreatur sind stielförmig, und die drei Augen befinden sich an einem hervorstehenden, einziehbaren Fortsatz. Die Augen sind bernsteinfarben mit grünem Schimmer und haben vertikale, geschlitzte Pupillen in leuchtendem Grün mit orangefarbenen Rändern.
Wenn sie untergetaucht ist, ihre Tentakel an Land hängen und ihre Augen- und Nasenstiele im Wasser liegen, scheint sie nichts weiter zu sein als eine Art von Pflanzenwuchs.
LEBENSRAUM / GESELLSCHAFT

Ein Froschhemoth lebt nur in großen Sümpfen oder in seichtem Süßwasser (bis zu 100 Fuß). Er kann sich auch auf dem Trockenen fortbewegen, bewegt sich aber in einer Reihe von unbeholfenen Sprüngen mit halber Geschwindigkeit.

Einmal alle neun Jahre kehren Froschfresser an ihren Laichplatz zurück, um sich mit anderen ihrer Art zu paaren. Jedes Paar legt 10 bis 100 Eier, die jeweils etwa einen Meter lang sind, in seichtem Wasser ab. Die Kaulquappen werden sofort sich selbst überlassen.

Immature froghemoths (tadhemoths) resemble fish (2 HD; AC 16) with four pectoral fins (which will turn into tentacles) and two tails (which will turn into legs). For 6 months, the creatures grows about a foot per month, then gains about a foot every 2 months until it reaches full size. At 6 months, the tentacles start to develop. By the 10th month the legs start to develop, and by the 12th month the tadhemoth stage has ended. Tadhemoths eat and are eaten by each other, only 10% survive more than a few days after hatching, and only 1% to 4% reach adult size. Barring violent death, froghemoths are thought to live up to 100 years.
ECOLOGIE

The froghemoth is very likely the dominant predator in its home region. Only very powerful creatures (like dragons or well-equipped adventurers) can hope to succeed against one. Froghemoth tadpoles cannot be trained, but it may be possible to capture one and move it someplace where it can act as a vicious and somewhat unreliable guard animal.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The giant makes two greataxe attacks.

action.name: Greataxe
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}25 ({@damage 3d12 + 6}) slashing damage, or 25 ({@damage 3d12 + 6}) slashing damage if used with both hands.

action.name: Rock
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 9} to hit, range 60/240 ft., one target. {@h}28 ({@damage 4d10 + 6}) bludgeoning damage.
{@link Frost Giant|https://angrygolem-games.com/monster-manual/letter-f/frost-giant-5e-stats/}
BESCHREIBUNG
Like all evil giants, frost giants have a reputation for crudeness and stupidity. This reputation is deserved, but frost giants are crafty fighters.

Frost giants have muscular, roughly human builds. The typical adult male is 21' tall and weighs about 8,000 pounds. Females are slightly shorter and lighter, but otherwise identical to males. Frost giants have snow-white or ivory skin. Their hair is light blue or dirty yellow, with matching eyes. They can live to be 250 years old.

Frost giants carry their belongings in huge sacks. A typical frost giant's sack contains {@dice 1d4+1} throwing rocks, the giant's wealth, and {@dice 3d4} mundane items. Everything in a giant's bag is old, worn, dirty, and smelly, making the identification of any valuable items difficult.
LEBENSRAUM / GESELLSCHAFT

Frost giants live in small bands consisting of a chief, his henchmen, and their camp followers. A band usually will occupy a crude castle or frigid cavern. When encountered in their lair there will be {@dice 1d8+8} {@creature giant|AGGMM}s; half of whom will be immature. To determine a giant's maturity, roll {@dice 1d4}. A roll of 4 indicates an infant with no combat ability and hit points of {@creature ogre|AGGMM3}; rolls of 1-3 indicate older progeny with hit dice, damage, and attack rolls equal to that of a stone giant.

Particularly strong or intelligent frost giant chieftains will command bands three or four times normal size. A chieftain who commands 20 or more giants is called a jarl. Jarls always will have better than normal armor and a weapon of +1 to +3 enchantment.
There is a 20% chance that any band of frost giants will have a shaman (80%) or witch doctor (20%).
If the group is led by a jarl, there is an 80% chance for a spell caster.
{@creature Frost giant shaman|AGGMM}s are priests of up to 7th level.
{@creature Frost giant witch doctor|AGGMM}s of up to 7th; they prefer spells that can bewilder and confound other giants.

Frost giants often capture and tame other creatures as guards. There is a 50% chance that a frost giant lair will contain {@dice 1d6} {@creature winter wolve|AGGMM4}s. Larger than normal groups check once for every eight giants.
Bands with 20 or more giants have a additional 30% chance to have {@dice 1d4} {@creature yeti|AGGMM4}, larger groups check once for every 16 giants.
A jarl's band has a 20% chance to have {@dice 1d2} subdued {@creature young white dragon|AGGMM}s in addition to other guards.

Frost giants also take captives to hold for ransom or use as slaves. There is a 15% chance that a lair will contain {@dice 1d2} captives, larger bands check once per eight giants. Captives can be of any race.
ECOLOGIE

Frost giants live in frigid, arctic lands with glaciers and heavy snowfall. Frost giants eat mostly meat, which they can hunt and kill themselves. They raid human and demi-human settlements for foodstuffs and other booty.

trait.name: Burning Fury
entries: When the salamander takes fire damage, its Freezing Breath automatically recharges.

trait.name: Freezing Aura
entries: It radiates cold in a 20-foot radius, causing {@dice 1d8} points of damage to all creatures within this area.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The salamander makes five attacks: four with its claws and one with its bite.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d6 + 5}) piercing damage.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d8 + 5}) piercing damage, plus 5 ({@damage 1d10}) cold damage.

action.name: Freezing Breath {@recharge}
entries: The salamander exhales chill wind in a 60-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 17} Constitution saving throw, taking 44 ({@damage 8d10}) cold damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
{@link Frost Salamander|https://angrygolem-games.com/monster-manual/letter-f/frost-salamander-5e-stats/}
BESCHREIBUNG

Frost salamanders, natives of the Paraelemental Plane of Ice, thrive in very cold places. They are sometimes found on other elemental planes and may find themselves summoned to the Prime Material Plane.

This creature looks like a large lizard with white or blue-white scales. Its six legs end in vicious claws that allow it to move along even the slickest ice. Frost salamanders have blue eyes and translucent white teeth that look like icicles.
The frost salamander gets its name because so many consider it a cold-dwelling version of the normal salamander, which comes from the Elemental Plane of Fire.
LEBENSRAUM / GESELLSCHAFT
Frost salamanders sometimes leave their otherplanar home to visit especially cold places on the Prime Material Plane for reasons known only to them, or through summoning.

Clearly, these creatures hate warm surroundings. In fact, they suffer 1 point of damage for each turn they spend in a region with a temperature above freezing. Typical frost salamander lairs are quite cold near frozen pools or on windy, arctic plains. They bask in chilling winds the way most creatures relax in sunlight; they enjoy being recipients of such spells as {@spell cone of cold}, too.

Items found in the lairs of frost salamanders often have frozen into blocks of ice or have turned very brittle from the cold; the low temperature almost always ruins magical potions. Melting treasure free can take several hours, and characters should not attempt to carry frozen items without hand coverings.
ECOLOGIE
Frost salamanders usually eat frozen meat but also can eat any plants they happen to find. These voracious predators prefer to avoid competition with other cold-dwelling creatures.
The sluggish, bright blue liquid in a frost salamanders veins can be used to temper a frost brand; a bone from this creature makes a fine component for a wand of frost.

Frost salamanders hate regular salamanders, and the enmity is returned; the two creatures attack one another on sight, on the rare occasions when they find themselves in the same place at the same time.

trait.name: Magical Lute
entries: With a single musical note of his magical lute, Fu-Hsing's avatar can cast any wizard spell of first through fourth level. He can cast up to five notes in a round, or up to five spells from first through fourth level.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: He can cast draw upon any school of magic to cast any spell appropriate to his level as a bard.

action.name: Dagger
entries: {@atk ms} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}3 ({@damage 1d4 + 1}) piercing damage.
{@link Fu Hsing, Chinese Avatar|https://angrygolem-games.com/monster-manual/letter-f/fu-hsing-chineses-avatar/}
BESCHREIBUNG
Fu-Hsing's avatar often appears as a grimy old man carrying a beat-up lute and singing a jolly song in a robust voice.
{@link God & Clergy (go to page)|https://angrygolem-games.com/monster-manual/letter-f/fu-hsing-god-and-clerics-for-dd-5e/}

trait.name: Blinding Beauty
entries: Any being that looks uninvited upon Gaea's avatar must roll a {@dc 27} charisma saving throw or be {@condition blinded} for {@dice 1d10} days.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: She can call upon the animal, charm, elemental, healing, plant, and weather spheres for her spells.

action.name: Sickle
entries: {@atk ms} {@hit 15} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 1d4 + 8}) piercing damage. Gaea's avatar wields a black sickle that forces all those hit by it to roll a {@dc 25} constitution saving throw or be instantly slain.
{@link Gaea, Greek Avatar|https://angrygolem-games.com/monster-manual/letter-g/gaea-greek-avatar/}
BESCHREIBUNG
Gaea's avatar takes the form of a mature, buxom beauty.
{@link God & Clergy (go to page)|https://angrygolem-games.com/monster-manual/letter-g/gaea-god-and-clerics-for-dd-5e/}

walk.condition: (30 ft. when rolling, 60 ft. rolling downhill)

trait.name: False Appearance
entries: While the galeb duhr remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from a normal boulder.

trait.name: Rolling Charge
entries: If the galeb duhr rolls at least 20 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with a slam attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 7 ({@damage 2d6}) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 16} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} Treffer, Reichweite 5 ft., ein Ziel. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d6 + 5}) Schaden durch Wucht.

action.name: Animate Boulders (1/Day)
entries: The galeb duhr magically animates up to two boulders it can see within 60 feet of it. A boulder has statistics like those of a galeb duhr, except it has Intelligence 1 and Charisma 1, it can't be {@condition charmed} or {@condition frightened}, and it lacks this action option. A boulder remains animated as long as the galeb duhr maintains concentration, up to 1 minute (as if concentrating on a spell).
{@link Galeb Duhr|https://angrygolem-games.com/monster-manual/letter-g/galeb-duhr-5e-stats/}
BESCHREIBUNG

The galeb duhr is a curious boulder-like creature with appendages that act as hands and feet. These intelligent beings are very large and slow-moving. They live in rocky or mountainous areas where they can feel the earth power and control the rocks around them.
A typical galeb duhr is from 6 to 12 feet tall. When not moving it looks like part of the terrain it lives in.
LEBENSRAUM / GESELLSCHAFT

Galeb duhr, thought to be native to the elemental plane of Earth, are sometimes encountered in small family groups in mountainous regions of the Prime Material plane. It is not known how (or whether) galeb duhr reproduce, but "young" galeb duhr have occasionally been reported those specimens encountered being a smaller size than normal.

While galeb duhr seem to have no visible culture above ground, they are known to collect gems, which they find through their passwall ability. They sometimes have small magical items in their possession, evidently taken from those who attacked them to take their gems.

The "music" of the galeb duhr often provides the first evidence that these creatures are near and usually the only evidence, as the unsociable galeb duhr are quick to pass into the ground when they feel the vibrations of approaching visitors.

Sitting together in groups, the galeb duhr harmonize their gravelly voices into eldritch tunes; some sages speculate that these melodies can cause or prevent earthquakes. Others argue that the low rumbling produced by these creatures is a form of warning to others in the group, but there is no conclusive evidence either way.
ECOLOGIE

Galeb duhr have no natural enemies, other than those who crave the gems they collect. Galeb duhr eat rock, preferring granite to other types, and disdaining any sedimentary type. The rocks they eat become part of the huge creatures; such a meal need take place only once every two or three months.

Besides the gems that they carry with them, galeb duhr are likely to know where many other gems are, as well as veins of precious metals, such as gold, silver, and platinum, though galeb duhr seem to have no interest in these minerals for themselves. A few powerful mages have been able to bargain with the galeb duhr for this information. This is a difficult agreement to consummate, for the galeb duhr are valiant fighters, and usually have no difficulty in escaping from any harm if they are inclined to do so. Further, the galeb duhr are territorial, and would be irritated at any attempt to make use of this knowledge in their vicinity.

In some strange way, galeb duhr feel responsible for the smaller rocks and boulders around them, in much the same way that a treant feels responsible for trees in its neighborhood. A traveler who disturbs the area near a galeb duhr does so at his own peril.
Galeb Duhr is employed as component to empower the following spells:{@spell Find Familiar}

resist.note: from nonmagical attacks that aren't adamantine

trait.name: False Appearance
entries: While the gargoyle remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from an inanimate statue.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The gargoyle makes two attacks: one with its bite and one with its claws.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} bis zum Treffer, Reichweite 5 ft., ein Ziel. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) Stich-Schaden.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) slashing damage.
{@link Gargoyle|https://angrygolem-games.com/monster-manual/letter-g/gargoyle/}
BESCHREIBUNG
These monsters are ferocious predators of a magical nature, typically found amid ruins or dwelling in underground caverns. They have their own guttural language.
LEBENSRAUM / GESELLSCHAFT

Gargoyles live in small groups with others of their kind, interested in little more than finding other creatures to hurt. Smaller animals are scarcely worth the trouble to these hideous monsters, who prefer to attack humans or other intelligent creatures.

Gargoyles often collect treasure from human victims. Individuals usually have a handful of gold pieces among them, with the bulk of their treasure hidden carefully at their lair, usually buried or under a large stone.
ECOLOGIE

Originally, gargoyles were carved roof spouts, representing grotesque human and animal figures. They were designed in such a way that water flowing down gutters would be thrown away from the wall, so as to prevent stains and erosion.

Later, some unknown mage used a powerful enchantment to bring these horrid sculptures to life. The race of gargoyles has flourished, spreading throughout the world. Gargoyles do not need to eat or drink, so they can stand motionless for as long as they wish almost anywhere.

The damage they do to other creatures is not for sustenance, but only for their distorted sense of pleasure. Because they are fairly intelligent and evil, they will sometimes serve an evil master of some sort. In this case, the gargoyles usually act as guards or messengers; besides some gold or a few gems. their unsavory payment is the enjoyment they get from attacking unwanted visitors.
The horn of the gargoyle is the more common active ingredient for a {@item potion of invulnerability} and can also be used in a {@item potion of flying}.
Gargoyle is employed as component to empower the following spells: {@spell Find Familiar}
{@link GARGOYLE's TACTICS (read the article)|}

trait.name: Death Burst
entries: The gas spore explodes when it drops to 0 hit points. Each creature within 20 feet of it must succeed on a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw or take 10 ({@damage 3d6}) poison damage and become infected with a disease on a failed save. Creatures immune to the {@condition poisoned} condition are immune to this disease. Spores invade an infected creature's system, killing the creature in a number of hours equal to {@dice 1d12} +the creature's Constitution score, unless the disease is removed. In half that time, the creature becomes {@condition poisoned} for the rest of the duration. After the creature dies, it sprouts {@dice 2d4} Tiny gas spores that grow to full size in 7 days.

trait.name: Eerie Resemblance
entries: The gas spore resembles a beholder. A creature that can see the gas spore can discern its true nature with a successful {@dc 15} Intell igence (Nature) check.

action.name: Touch
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 0} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}1 ({@damage 1}) poison damage, and the creature must succeed on a {@dc 10} Constitution saving throw or become infected with the disease described in the Death Burst trait.
{@link Gas Spore|https://angrygolem-games.com/monster-manual/letter-g/gas-spore-5e-stats/}
BESCHREIBUNG

At any distance greater than 10 feet, a gas spore is likely to be mistaken for a beholder. Even at close ranges there is a possibility that the creature is seen as a beholder, for a gas spore has a false central eye and rhizome growths atop it that strongly resemble the eye stalks of a beholder.

trait.name: Stunning Gaze
entries: When a creature that can see the gauth's cen-tral eye starts its turn within 30 feet of the gauth, the gauth can force it to make a {@dc 14} Wisdom saving throw if the gauth isn't {@condition incapacitated} and can see the creature. A creature that fails the save is {@condition stunned} until the start of its next turn. Unless surprised, a creature can avert its eyes at the start of its turn to avoid the saving throw. If the creature does so, it can't see the gauth until the start of its next turn, when it can avert its eyes again. If the creature looks at the gauth in the meantime, it must immediately make the save.

trait.name: Death Throes
entries: When the gauth dies, the magical energy within it explodes, and each creature within 10 feet of it must make a {@dc 14} Dexterity saving throw, taking 13 ({@damage 3d8}) force damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 2d8}) piercing damage.

action.name: Eye Rays
entries: The gauth shoots three of the following magical eye rays at random (reroll duplicates), choosing one to three targets it can see within 120 feet of it:

items: {@b 1. Devour Magic Ray.} The targeted creature must succeed on a {@dc 14} Dexterity saving throw or have one of its magic items lose all magical properties until the start of the gauth's next turn. If the object is a charged item, it also loses {@dice 1d4} charges. Determine the affected item randomly, ignoring single-use items such as potions and scrolls.
{@b 2. Enervation Ray.} The targeted creature must make a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw, taking 18 ({@damage 4d8}) necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

{@b 3. Pushing Ray.} The targeted creature must succeed on a {@dc 14} Strength saving throw or be pushed up to 15 feet directly away from the gauth and have its speed halved until the start of the gauth's next turn.
{@b 4. Fire Ray.} The targeted creature must succeed on a {@dc 14} Dexterity saving throw or take 22 ({@damage 4d10}) fire damage.

{@b 5. Paralyzing Roy.} The targeted creature must succeed on a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition paralyzed} for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

{@b 6. Sleep Roy.} The targeted creature must succeed on a {@dc 14} Wisdom saving throw or fall asleep and remain {@condition unconscious} for 1 minute. The target awakens if it takes damage or another creature takes an action to wake it. This ray has no effect on constructs and undead.

entries: {@link Gauth|https://angrygolem-games.com/monster-manual/letter-g/gauth-5e-stats/}
BESCHREIBUNG

The Gauth is a relative of the beholder that feeds on magic. Its spherical body is 5 feet in diameter and brown in color, mottled with purple and gray. Located in the center of the gauth's forward hemisphere is a large central eye surrounded by a ring of smaller eyes that are protected by ridges of tough flesh. These secondary body eyes provide the creature with normal vision in lighted areas and infravision to 90 feet. On the underside is the beast's fearsome mouth with its accompanying cluster of four feeding tendrils, while the top is adorned with a crown of six eye stalks.
While the gauth is similar to the beholder, its ability to feed on the energy of magical objects makes it even more dangerous in some ways.

When a gauth moves into combat, it begins to glow, much as if it were the object of a faerie fire spell, to attract the attention of its foes. A creature that meets the gaze of the central eye must roll a successful saving throw vs. spell, with a -2 penalty, or be affected as if the victim of a feeblemind spell.

If a gauth chooses to bite with its great maw, the sharp fangs inflict {@dice 3d4} points of damage. The four tendrils around the mouth can grab and hold victims as if they had a Strength of 18, but they can inflict no damage.
A gauth in combat can also employ its six eye stalks.

Perhaps the most feared of the gauth's powers, its dweomer drain, permits the gauth to drain charges from magical items. It has a 40-foot range and can be targeted on one individual per round. In addition to preventing one object from functioning for the duration of that round, this power drains one charge from one charged object. Permanent objects, such as magical swords, are rendered powerless for one round by this ability. Artifacts are not affected by the dweomer drain. The eye has no effect on spells that have been memorized (but not yet cast) and it will not break the concentration of a wizard. It does neutralize any spell cast by its target that round, however.

A {@spell dispel magic} spell cast on any of the gauth's eye stalks prevents its use for {@dice 1d4} rounds. The central eye, any fully retracted eye stalks, the body's ability to glow, and the gauth's natural levitation are not subject to injury by such a spell.

If a gauth is slain, its magical energy dissipates. Usually, this is a harmless event, but there is a 2% chance that it is catastrophic, inflicting {@dice 4d4} points of damage to all creatures within 10 feet (no saving throw). Gauth are immune to their own powers and to those of other gauth. They have an unusual physiology that enables them to regenerate 1 hit point every two turns.

Although gauth are not known to fight over territories or prey, they do go to great lengths to avoid each other. Even when they encounter another of their kind in the wilderness, they often ignore them utterly.

A gauth can survive by eating meat but it greatly prefers to devour magical objects. In some unknown manner, the creature is able to absorb magical energy and feed on it. Each turn that an object spends in the gauth's stomach causes it to lose one charge. A permanent object is rendered inoperative after one day (artifacts are not affected, nor do they provide sustenance). Magical objects that cannot be entirely digested by a gauth are spat out after they have been drained of all their power.

Gauth are thought to live a century or so. Within a week of their natural death, two young gauth emerge from the corpse. Although smaller than their parent (each has 2 or 3 HD and a bite that causes only {@dice 2d4} points of damage), they have all the powers of a full-grown adult.

trait.name: Aggressive
entries: As a bonus action, the gazer can move up to its speed toward a hostile creature that it can see.

trait.name: Mimicry
entries: The gazer can mimic simple sounds of speech it has heard, in any language. A creature that hears the sounds can tell they are imitations with a successful {@dc 10} Wisdom (Insight) check.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1}) piercing damage.

action.name: Eye Rays
entries: The gazer shoots two of the following magical eye rays at random (reroll duplicates), choosing one or two targets it can see within 60 feet of it:

items: {@b 1. Dazing Ray.} The targeted creature must succeed on a {@dc 12} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition charmed} until the start of the gazer's next turn. While the target is {@condition charmed} in this way, its speed is halved, and it has disadvantage on attack rolls.
{@b 2. Fear Ray.} The targeted creature must succeed on a {@dc 12} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition frightened} until the start of the gazer's next turn.
{@b 3. Frost Ray.} The targeted creature must succeed on a {@dc 12} Dexterity saving throw or take 10 ({@damage 3d6}) cold damage.

{@b 4. Telekinetic Ray.} If the target is a creature that is Medium or smaller, it must succeed on a {@dc 12} Strength saving throw or be moved up to 30 feet directly away from the gazer. If the target is an object weighing 10 pounds or less that isn't being worn or carried, the gazer moves it up to 30 feet in any direction. The gazer can also exert fine control on objects with this ray, such as manipulating a simple tool or opening a container.

entries: {@link Gazer|https://angrygolem-games.com/monster-manual/letter-g/gazer-5e-stats/}
BESCHREIBUNG

A gazer is a tiny manifestation of a beholder's dreams. It resembles the beholder who dreamed it into existence, but its body is only 8 inches wide, and it has only four eyestalks. It follows its creator like a devoted, aggressive puppy, and sometimes small packs of these creatures patrol their master's lair for vermin to kill and lone creatures to harass.

trait.name: Son of the Earth
entries: Geb's avalar can regenerate 25 hit points per tum when he is in contact with the earth.

trait.name: Lord of Elements (1/Day)
entries: Once per day, he can summon 2-8 earth 15 HD earth elementals to fight for him.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: He can draw upon any school of magic for his spell abilities. He can employ an imprisonment spell once per round, no matter what other action he is attempting.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Geb's avatar makes two attacks with his staff.

action.name: Staff
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 25} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}18 ({@damage 1d6 + 14}) bludgeoning damage, or 18 ({@damage 1d8 + 14}) bludgeoning damage if used with both hands.
{@link Geb, Egyptian Avatar|https://angrygolem-games.com/monster-manual/letter-g/geb-egyptians-avatar/}
BESCHREIBUNG

Geb's avatar, like the god himself, appears as a hulking man with dark brown skin and smoldering eyes. He traditionally carries a quarterstaff +3 in combat that can duplicate the function of any magical item or magic spell relating to the earth. For example, he can command it to function as a spade of colossal excavation or to cast a transmute rock to mud spell.
{@link God & Clergy (go to page)|https://angrygolem-games.com/monster-manual/letter-g/geb-god-and-clerics-for-dd-5e/}

trait.name: Ooze Cube
entries: The cube takes up its entire space. Other creatures can enter the space, but a creature that does so is subjected to the cube's Engulf and has disadvantage on the saving throw.
Creatures inside the cube can be seen but have total cover.

A creature within 5 feet of the cube can take an action to pull a creature or object out of the cube. Doing so requires a successful {@dc 12} Strength check, and the creature making the attempt takes 10 ({@damage 3d6}) acid damage.
The cube can hold only one Large creature or up to four Medium or smaller creatures inside it at a time.

trait.name: Transparent
entries: Even when the cube is in plain sight, it takes a successful {@dc 15} Wisdom (Perception) check to spot a cube that has neither moved nor attacked. A creature that tries to enter the cube's space while unaware of the cube is surprised by the cube.

action.name: Pseudopod
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 3d6}) acid damage.

action.name: Engulf
entries: The cube moves up to its speed. While doing so, it can enter Large or smaller creatures' spaces. Whenever the cube enters a creature's space, the creature must make a {@dc 12} Dexterity saving throw.
On a successful save, the creature can choose to be pushed 5 feet back or to the side of the cube. A creature that chooses not to be pushed suffers the consequences of a failed saving throw.

On a failed save, the cube enters the creature's space, and the creature takes 10 ({@damage 3d6}) acid damage and is engulfed. The engulfed creature can't breathe, is {@condition restrained}, and takes 21 ({@damage 6d6}) acid damage at the start of each of the cube's turns. When the cube moves, the engulfed creature moves with it.
An engulfed creature can try to escape by taking an action to make a {@dc 12} Strength check. On a success, the creature escapes and enters a space of its choice within 5 feet of the cube.
{@link Gelatinous Cube|https://angrygolem-games.com/monster-manual/letter-g/gelatinous-cube/}
{@link GELATINOUS CUBE's TACTICS (read the article)|https://angrygolem-games.com/monster-tactics-fight-like-an-ooze/}
BESCHREIBUNG

So nearly transparent that they are difficult to see, these cubes travel down dungeon corridors, absorbing carrion and trash along the way. Their sides glisten, tending to leave a slimy trail, but gelatinous cubes cannot climb walls or cling to ceilings. Very large cubes grow tall to garner mosses and the like from ceilings.
LEBENSRAUM / GESELLSCHAFT

Possessing no intelligence, gelatinous cubes live only for eating. They prefer well- traveled dungeons where there is always food to scavenge. These creatures reproduce by budding, leaving clear, rubbery cubes in dark corners or on heaps of trash. Young are not protected and are sometimes reabsorbed by the parent.

Treasure is sometimes swept up by a gelatinous cube as the creature travels along a cavern floor; any metals, gems, or jewelry are carried in the monster's body until they can be ejected as indigestible.
ECOLOGIE

The gelatinous cube is sometimes encouraged to stay in a certain area for its scavenging abilities, and is preferred over other jellies and oozes since its square shape does not allow it to slither under doors and into areas in which it is not desired.
Gelatinous cube is employed as material component to empower the following spells:{@spell Acid Splash}, {@spell Grease}, {@spell Prestidigitation}

trait.name: Stench
entries: Any creature that starts its turn within 5 feet of the ghast must succeed on a {@dc 10} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition poisoned} until the start of its next turn. On a successful saving throw, the creature is immune to the ghast's Stench for 24 hours.

trait.name: Turning Defiance
entries: The ghast and any ghouls within 30 feet of it have advantage on saving throws against effects that turn undead.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d8 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) slashing damage. If the target is a creature other than an undead, it must succeed on a {@dc 10} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition paralyzed} for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.
{@link Ghast|https://angrygolem-games.com/monster-manual/letter-g/ghast/}
{@link GHAST's TACTICS (read the article)|https://angrygolem-games.com/monster-tactics-fight-like-a-a-ghoul/}
Ghast is employed as material component to empower the following spells: {@spell Ray of Sickness}

monster.name: Ghost
languages: Any Languages It Knew In Life

trait.name: Ethereal Sight
entries: The ghost can see 60 ft. into the Ethereal Plane when it is on the Material Plane, and vice versa.

trait.name: Incorporeal Movement
entries: The ghost can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

action.name: Withering Touch
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}17 ({@damage 4d6 + 3}) necrotic damage.

action.name: Etherealness
entries: The ghost enters the Ethereal Plane from the Material Plane, or vice versa. It is visible on the Material Plane while it is in the Border Ethereal, and vice versa, yet it can't affect or be affected by anything on the other plane.

action.name: Horrifying Visage
entries: Each non-undead creature within 60 ft. of the ghost that can see it must succeed on a {@dc 13} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. If the save fails by 5 or more, the target also ages {@dice 1d4 x 10} years. A {@condition frightened} target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the {@condition frightened} condition on itself on a success. If a target's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the target is immune to this ghost's Horrifying Visage for the next 24 hours. The aging effect can be reversed with a {@spell greater restoration} spell, but only within 24 hours of it occurring.

action.name: Possession {@recharge}
entries: One humanoid that the ghost can see within 5 ft. of it must succeed on a {@dc 13} Charisma saving throw or be possessed by the ghost; the ghost then disappears, and the target is {@condition incapacitated} and loses control of its body. The ghost now controls the body but doesn't deprive the target of awareness. The ghost can't be targeted by any attack, spell, or other effect, except ones that turn undead, and it retains its alignment, Intelligence, Wisdom, Charisma, and immunity to being {@condition charmed} and {@condition frightened}. It otherwise uses the possessed target's statistics, but doesn't gain access to the target's knowledge, class features, or proficiencies. The possession lasts until the body drops to 0 hit points, the ghost ends it as a bonus action, or the ghost is turned or forced out by an effect like the dispel evil and good spell. When the possession ends, the ghost reappears in an unoccupied space within 5 ft. of the body. The target is immune to this ghost's Possession for 24 hours after succeeding on the saving throw or after the possession ends.
{@link Ghost|https://angrygolem-games.com/monster-manual/letter-g/ghost-5e-stats/}
BESCHREIBUNG

Ghosts are the spirits of humans who were either so greatly evil in life or whose deaths were so unusually emotional they have been cursed with the gift of undead status. Thus, they roam about at night or in places of darkness. These spirits hate goodness and life, hungering to draw the living essences from the living.
LEBENSRAUM / GESELLSCHAFT
In most cases, a ghost is confined to a small physical area, which the ghost haunts. Those who have heard stories of a haunted area can thus attempt to avoid it for their own safety.

A ghost often has a specific purpose in its haunting, sometimes trying to "get even" for something that happened during the ghost's life. Thus a woman who was jilted by a lover, and then committed suicide, might become a ghost and haunt the couple's secret trysting place. Similarly, a man who failed at business might appear each night at his storefront or, perhaps, at that of a former competitor.

Another common reason for an individual to become a ghost is the denial of a proper burial. A ghost might inhabit the area near its body, waiting for a passerby to promise to bury the remains. The ghost, in its resentment toward all life, becomes an evil creature intent on destruction and suffering.

In rare circumstances, more than one ghost will haunt the same location. The classic example of this is the haunted ship, a vessel lost at sea, now ethereal and crewed entirely by ghosts. These ships are most often encountered in the presence of St. Elmo's fire, an electrical discharge that causes mysterious lights to appear in the rigging of a ship.

In many cases, a ghost can be overcome by those who might be no match for it in combat simply by setting right whatever events led to the attainment of the ghost's undead status. For example, a young woman who was betrayed and murdered by someone who pretended to love her might be freed from her curse if the cad were humiliated and ruined. In many cases, however, a ghost's revenge will be far more demanding, often ending in the death of the offender.
ECOLOGIE

The dreadful fear caused by the ghost, which ages a victim 10 years, is not well understood by the common man, who often ascribes it to the fact that a ghost is "dead". If this were the case, then certainly skeletons and zombies would have the same effect, which they do not.

Common folklore further confuses this fact by relating details of the ghost's physical form: the classic example of which is the headless horseman, thought by many to be particularly frightening simply because he had no head. Under this belief, one could face a ghost if only one had the courage to stand up to him. Such a mistaken impression has cost many lives over the years. Actually, the fear is caused by the supernatural power of the ghost, and has nothing whatsoever to do with courage.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 2} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 2d6 + 2}) piercing damage.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 2d4 + 2}) slashing damage. If the target is a creature other than an undead, it must succeed on a {@dc 10} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition paralyzed} for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.
{@link Ghoul|https://angrygolem-games.com/monster-manual/letter-g/ghoul/}
{@link GHOUL's TACTICS (read the article)|https://angrygolem-games.com/monster-tactics-fight-like-a-a-ghoul/}
BESCHREIBUNG

Ghouls are undead creatures, once human, who now feed on the flesh of corpses. Although the change from human to ghoul has deranged and destroyed their minds, ghouls have a terrible running which enables them to hunt their prey most effectively.

Ghouls are vaguely recognizable as once having been human, but have become horribly disfigured by their change to ghouls. The tongue becomes long and tough for licking marrow from cracked bones, the teeth become sharp and elongated, and the
nails grow strong and sharp like claws.
LEBENSRAUM / GESELLSCHAFT
Ghouls and ghasts are most frequently encountered around graveyards where they can find plenty of corpses on which to feed.
ECOLOGIE
Ghouls (and ghasts) delight in revolting and loathsome things from which we draw our adjectives "ghoulish and "ghastly."
Ghoul is employed as material component to empower the following spells: {@spell Chill Touch}, {@spell Faerie Fire}, {@spell Toll the Dead}, {@spell Ray of Sickness}

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Der Affe führt zwei Faustangriffe aus.

action.name: Fist
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}22 ({@damage 3d10 + 6}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Rock
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 9} to hit, range 50/100 ft., one target. {@h}30 ({@damage 7d6 + 6}) bludgeoning damage.
{@link Giant Ape|https://angrygolem-games.com/monster-manual/letter-g/giant-ape-5e-stats/}

trait.name: Keen Smell
entries: Der Dachs hat einen Vorteil bei Weisheitsprüfungen (Wahrnehmung), die auf Geruch beruhen.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The badger makes two attacks: one with its bite and one with its claws.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} bis zum Treffer, Reichweite 5 ft., ein Ziel. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d6 + 1}) Stich-Schaden.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 2d4 + 1}) slashing damage.
{@link Giant Badger|https://angrygolem-games.com/monster-manual/letter-g/giant-badger-5e-stats/}
BESCHREIBUNG

These semi-intelligent, burrowing mammals are typical solitary. They are fierce fighters and will staunchly defend their territory. If more than one is encountered, it will be a mated pair (and young). Giant badgers are sometimes found as guard animals in gnomes' lairs (20% chance for {@dice 3d4} {@creature giant badger|AGGMM}s in a lair). Giant badgers grow to twice the size of the normal {@creature badger|AGGMM}.

trait.name: Echolocation
entries: Die Fledermaus kann ihr Blindsight nicht benutzen, während {@condition deafened}.

trait.name: Keen Hearing
entries: Die Fledermaus hat einen Vorteil bei Weisheitsprüfungen (Wahrnehmung), die auf dem Gehör basieren.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} bis zum Treffer, Reichweite 5 ft., ein Ziel. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) Stich-Schaden.
{@link Giant Bat|https://angrygolem-games.com/monster-manual/letter-g/giant-bat-mobat-5e-stats/}
BESCHREIBUNG

Mobats prefer warm-blooded prey that they bite to death with their fangs. They have a dim and evil intelligence that gives them a desire for shiny objects. Because the typical mobat has a wingspan of 12 to 16 feet, they must have large areas to serve as flight runways. Because Mobats' flight is so rapid and silent, their victims suffer disadvantage on perception checks.

trait.name: Charge
entries: If the boar moves at least 20 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with a tusk attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 7 ({@damage 2d6}) slashing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 13} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

trait.name: Relentless (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: If the boar takes 10 damage or less that would reduce it to 0 hit points, it is reduced to 1 hit point instead.

action.name: Tusk
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} bis zum Treffer, Reichweite 5 ft., ein Ziel. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) Hiebschaden.
{@link Giant Boar|https://angrygolem-games.com/monster-manual/letter-g/giant-boar-5e-stats/}
BESCHREIBUNG
This prehistoric forerunner of the wild boar is also very aggressive.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) piercing damage, plus 10 ({@damage 3d6}) poison damage. The target must succeed on a {@dc 11} Constitution saving throw or take the poison damage. If the poison damage reduces the target to 0 hit points, the target is stable but {@condition poisoned} for 1 hour, even after regaining hit points, and is {@condition paralyzed} while {@condition poisoned} in this way.
{@link Giant Centipede|https://angrygolem-games.com/monster-manual/letter-g/giant-centipede-5e-stats/}
BESCHREIBUNG
Giant centipedes are crawling arthropods that arouse almost universal disgust from all intelligent creatures (even other monsters). They are endemic to most regions.

One of the things that makes the centipede so repulsive is its resemblance to the worm. Its long body is divided into many segments from which protrude many tiny feet. Hence the name "centipede" (or hundred-footed). The giant centipede is so named because it is over 1-foot long. The body is plated with a chitinous shell and it moves with a slight undulating motion. The creature has the added benefit of protective coloration, and varies in color depending on the terrain it inhabits. Those that favor rocky areas are gray, those that live underground are black, while centipedes of the forest are brown or red.
COMBAT

When hunting, centipedes use their natural coloration to remain unseen until they can drop on their prey from above or crawl out of hiding in pursuit of food. They attack by biting their foes and injecting a paralytic poison.

Although a single giant centipede rarely constitutes a serious threat to a man, these creatures frequently travel in groups. When more than one centipede is encountered, the monsters will fight independently, even to the point of fighting among themselves over fallen victims.
LEBENSRAUM / GESELLSCHAFT

The centipede behaves like most other insects, roving from place to place in search of food; it has no set territory or dwelling. The centipede simply goes where its hunger leads it. It is an aggressive and hungry carnivore that must eat at least once a day to survive. Hungry centipedes often resort to cannibalism.
ECOLOGIE

Giant centipedes have several natural advantages, including poison and protective coloration, allowing them to compete with other small predators for game. Their poison bestows a certain immunity from being hunted, but hungry and skilled animals such as coyotes and large predatory birds hunt them effectively in lean times.
Their preferred targets are small mammals that are easily overcome by their weak poison. If they are very hungry, however, they have been known to attack anything that moves, including humans.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 10 ft., one creature. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) piercing damage.

action.name: Constrict
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) bludgeoning damage, and the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 16}). Until this grapple ends, the creature is {@condition restrained}, and the snake can't constrict another target.
{@link Giant Constrictor Snake|https://angrygolem-games.com/monster-manual/letter-g/giant-constrictor-snake-5e-stats/}
BESCHREIBUNG

Giant constrictor snakes are larger and much stronger than the smaller {@creature constrictor snake|AGGMM}s. It requires the combined efforts of 60 total points of Strength (the coiled victim plus outside help) to extricate someone from a giant constrictor's steel grasp and a successful DC 16 escape check.
The skin of a giant constrictor snake is too thick and stiff to be workable, and is valuable only as armor, not for decoration. An uncured hide can fetch 20 gp.

trait.name: Hold Breath
entries: The crocodile can hold its breath for 30 minutes.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The crocodile makes two attacks: one with its bite and one with its tail.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}21 ({@damage 3d10 + 5}) piercing damage, and the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 16}). Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained}, and the crocodile can't bite another target.

action.name: Tail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d8 + 5}) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 16} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.
{@link Giant Crocodile|https://angrygolem-games.com/monster-manual/letter-g/giant-crocodile-5e-stats/}
BESCHREIBUNG

These creatures are far rarer than their smaller cousins, the {@creature crocodile|AGGMM}s. They attain sizes from 21 to 30 feet long, and they also continue to grow until death. Giant crocodiles typically inhabit salt water or prehistoric settings, where they have been know to prey upon {@creature shark|AGGMM3}s, small whales, and small seagoing crafts, such as fishing boats. When attacking a small boat, their favorite technique is to ram it, attempting to capsize and smash it open with their huge jaws. They have been known to gorge upon the catch within the fishing boats, and then to swim away, leaving the fishermen unharmed.

monster.name: Giant Eagle
languages: understands Common and Auran but can't speak

trait.name: Keen Sight
entries: Der Adler hat einen Vorteil bei Weisheitsprüfungen (Wahrnehmung), die sich auf das Sehen beziehen.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The eagle makes two attacks: one with its beak and one with its talons.

action.name: Beak
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Talons
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} bis zum Treffer, Reichweite 5 ft., ein Ziel. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) Hiebschaden.
{@link Giant Eagle|https://angrygolem-games.com/monster-manual/letter-g/giant-eagle-5e-stats/}
BESCHREIBUNG

Giant eagles usually stand 10 feet tall and have wing spans of up to 20 feet. They share the coloration and fighting methods of their smaller cousins, the eagle, inflicting much more damage. However, if a giant eagle dives more than 50 feet, it gains advantage to its attack roll and doubles its normal talon damage.

Giant eagles build their nests only in high mountain passes, where they have room to fly undisturbed. They are far more social than wild eagles, and up to 20 have been discovered nesting in the same area. One nest will be found for each pair of giant eagles. There is a 50% chance that 1d4 eggs are present in a nest, or a 25% chance of 1d4 young. If there are young or eggs in the nest, the giant eagle will attack any creature within 50 feet of the nest. Eagles are always suspicious of any creature coming near a nest, whether eaglets are present or not, as this is where their treasure is to be found.

Some individual dwarves and elves and sometims even groups of dwarves and elves are considered friends by giant eagles. Members of the two races are considered less of a threat than humans. Giant eagles can be trained, and their eggs sell for 500 to 800 gp each on the open market.

trait.name: Charge
entries: If the elk moves at least 20 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with a ram attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 7 ({@damage 2d6}) damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 14} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Ram
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Hooves
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one {@condition prone} creature. {@h}22 ({@damage 4d8 + 4}) bludgeoning damage.
{@link Giant Elk|https://angrygolem-games.com/monster-manual/letter-g/giant-elk-5e-stats/}

trait.name: Illumination
entries: The beetle sheds bright light in a 10-foot radius and dim light for an additional 10 feet.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 1} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}2 ({@damage 1d6 -1}) slashing damage.
{@link Giant Fire Beetle|https://angrygolem-games.com/monster-manual/letter-g/giant-fire-beetle-5e-stats/}
BESCHREIBUNG
Giant beetles are similar to their more ordinary counterparts, but thousands of times larger with chewing mandibles and hard wings that provide substantial armor protection.

Beetles have two pairs of wings and three pairs of legs. Fortunately, the wings of a giant beetle cannot be used to fly, and in most cases, its six bristly legs do not enable it to move as fast as a fleeing man. The hard, chitinous shell of several varieties of these beetles are brightly colored, and sometimes have value to art collectors. While their shells protect beetles as well as plate mail armor, it is difficult to craft armor from them, and a skilled alchemist would need to be brought in on the job.

All beetles are basically unintelligent and always hungry. They will feed on virtually any form of organic material, including other sorts of beetles. They taste matter with their antennae, or feelers; if a substance tasted is organic, the beetle grasps it with its mandibles, crushes it, and eats it. Because of the thorough grinding of the mandibles, nothing eaten by giant beetles can be revived by anything short of a wish. Beetles do not hear or see well, and rely primarily on taste and feel.
Except as noted below, giant beetles are not really social animals; those that are found near each other are competitors for the same biological niche, not part of any family unit.

The smallest of the giant beetles, fire beetles are nevertheless capable of delivering serious damage with their powerful mandibles. They are found both above and below ground, and are primarily nocturnal.
COMBAT
Despite its name, the fire beetle has no fire attacks, relying instead on its huge mandibles to inflict the damage of a short sword in a single attack.
ECOLOGIE

Fire beetles have two special glands above their eyes and one near the back of their abdomens. These glands produce a luminous red glow, and for this reason they are highly prized by miners and adventurers. This luminosity persists for 1d6 days after the glands are removed from the beetle, and the light shed will illuminate a radius of 10 feet.

The light from these glands is cold it produces no heat. Many mages and alchemists are eager to discover the secret of this cold light, which could be not only safe, but economical, with no parts to heat up and burn out. In theory, they say, such a light source could last forever.
Giant Fire Beetle is employed as material component to empower the following spells:{@spell Grease}

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: Der Frosch kann Luft und Wasser atmen

trait.name: Standing Leap
entries: The frog's long jump is up to 20 ft. and its high jump is up to 10 ft., with or without a running start.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d6 + 1}) piercing damage. The target is {@condition grappled} (escape dc 11) Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained}, and the frog can't bite another target.

action.name: Swallow
entries: The frog makes one bite attack against a Small or smaller target it is grappling. If the attack hits, the target is swallowed, and the grapple ends. The swallowed target is {@condition blinded} and {@condition restrained}, it has total cover against attacks and other effects outside the frog, and it takes 5 ({@damage 2d4}) acid damage at the start of each of the frog's turns. The frog can have only one target swallowed at a time. If the frog dies, a swallowed creature is no longer {@condition restrained} by it and can escape from the corpse using 5 ft. of movement, exiting {@condition prone}.
{@link Giant Frog|https://angrygolem-games.com/monster-manual/letter-g/giant-frog/}
{@link GIANT FROG's TACTICS (read the article)|https://angrygolem-games.com/monster-tactics-fight-like-a-giant-frog/}
BESCHREIBUNG
Giant frogs resemble their more common relatives in everything but size. Their enormous size means that they consider larger creatures as a source of food, making smaller creatures possible prey.

A giant frog can range from 2 to 6 feet in length and weigh between 50 and 250 pounds (a 2-foot frog weighs 50 pounds, adding 50 pounds for each additional foot of length). A giant frog cannot jump backward or directly to either side, but can leap 30 feet straight up.
LEBENSRAUM / GESELLSCHAFT
